oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Variation in antibiotic treatment protocols used on large midwestern dairy farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Juliano, L.C.B.
Rodriguez, Z.
Portillo-Gonzalez, R.
Habing, G.G.
Ruegg, P.L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Antimicrobials are used on dairy farms to treat bacterial infec­tions and are most used to manage mastitis. The aim was to de­scribe variation in antibiotic treatment protocols on MI and OH dairy farms. We hypothesized that frequency, dosage and dura­tion of antibiotic treatments would vary among farms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 238
